text:
Hello, <@U04BDUU197Z>, <@U01VDC391QS> hope you are doing well. Let me know if I can do anything to help with the production credentials :pray:
Also I would like to check with you if it makes sense to create distinct users for production for the different roles:
• validator wallet operator (or whatever the current role filled by `trakx-validator-1::1220f2acce9d7491505ee5fabb548e9975bbf0f8efaae98404d7399922fb48a03aeb` is
• service provider actor for Trakx
• registrar service actor
• holder service actor
• issuer role
or if that sounds like an overkill, and people tend to have the same user for all these roles (this is the current setup in TestNet for us)

text: hey Alex, quick question: how many results do you get back from the query for active contracts?

text:
on our side we use

```  - name: ADDITIONAL_CONFIG_HTTP_JSON_API
    value: canton.participants.participant.http-ledger-api.websocket-config.http-list-max-elements-limit=1000```

text: <@U029VGVV25Q> do you know the answer to Alex's question ^?

elements.text: do you know the answer to Alex's question ^?

text:
Hi,
Probably there will be no paging on `active contract sets` (and other similar endpoints)  etc.
Technically there is no simple way to provide paging here it in a consistent, efficient way - problem is not json api - but already in core / gRPC ledger.

We provide websocket connection with that allows to load all the data. Initially we only wanted to provide websocket access (but added json list as alternative in case you need simple solution for small (by the amount of data) applications).

As for cutting the results - this is a deficiency we are working on - we will introduce at least clear error when this happens.

elements.text:
Hi,
Probably there will be no paging on
active contract sets

(and other similar endpoints)  etc.
Technically there is no simple way to provide paging here it in a consistent, efficient way - problem is not json api - but already in core / gRPC ledger.

We provide websocket connection with that allows to load all the data. Initially we only wanted to provide websocket access (but added json list as alternative in case you need simple solution for small (by the amount of data) applications).

As for cutting the results - this is a deficiency we are working on - we will introduce at least clear error when this happens.

text:
Thanks for the answer.
Is that documented somewhere? are there more limitations we might run into?
This is a surprise.
We have developed everything with json api (according to DA recommendation) and we are not aiming for a small application...
